thread.title: 'Like a toboggan out here': 55 vehicles involved in Route 128 crash

author: Justin Timberlake reveals why he left *NSYNC
title: 'Like a toboggan out here': 55 vehicles involved in Route 128 crash
text:

CBS Boston See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next Senate Democrats criticize GOP for 'twisting the rules' to silence Warren The Washington Post 2:56 Trump makes argument for travel ban CBS News 7:05 A Filibuster on a Supreme Court Nomination Is So Rare It’s Only Worked Once Time 3:09 Icy Roads Cause 55-Car Pileup In Mass. CBS Boston 2:09 DeVos calls her confirmation process 'a bit of a bear' USA TODAY 1:01 ISIS Supporter of Texas Attack Sentenced to 30 Years In Prison Wochit News 0:41 Low Trump Approval Rating No Cause for Panic -- Yet The Wall Street Journal. 1:45 Woman hangs onto 8-week-old daughter as tornado rips through workplace FOX News 0:52 Senate Dems Read Coretta Scott King's Letter Associated Press 2:31 Judges Block North Carolina Law Limiting Governor Wochit News 0:43 Here's How Many Fake Twitter Followers Trump Has Buzz60 1:11 The Real Reason Why North Korea Is So Isolated Seeker 2:53 William Boyette dead, Mary Rice in custody, ending murder spree TODAY 0:29 Senate Democrats Pull All-Nighter To Oppose Jeffrey Sessions CBS Miami 1:28 Strong Storms Cause Flooding in Central California NBC News 0:56 Hawaiian caught on video swimming next to lava flow FOX News 0:54 UP NEXT A 55-vehicle pileup in Wakefield that included tractor-trailers is just one of several multi-vehicle crashes reported early Wednesday on icy roads across Massachusetts.
The crash happened in a northbound lane of Route 128 near the Route 129 exit, according to Massachusetts State Police.
A motorist involved in the crash said it "was like a toboggan out there." Crews worked to remove the tangled mess of damaged vehicles, including oil trucks and tractor-trailers.
The wet pavement turned into a sheet of ice just before 6 a.m. Some drivers said they slid for a quarter of a mile, trying to brake.
Check school delays | Check Traffic | Futurecast: Track rain, snow
Joe Ramsey and other drivers tried to help some of the injured.
“He was trapped in there for a little while,” Ramsey said. “We just kept him warm.”
Joseph Tavares was on his way to work when he jumped out to help others.
“Even if you were doing 10 mph, you would have ended up in this mess,” he said.
“As I sat here, just kept hearing cars banging into each other,” said Scott Allison.
Allison's truck was surrounded by wreckage, but somehow the spin-outs left his vehicle without a scratch.
“Thank God. I'm going to play the lottery now,” he said.
Eight people suffered minor injuries, police said. The highway was completely shut down for several hours before reopening.
Gov. Charlie Baker announced a 2-hour delay for all non-emergency state employees due to the icy road conditions and highway closures.
“We urge all drivers to exercise extreme caution as driving is very difficult due to icy conditions and to be patient as public safety officials respond to multiple incidents impacting our highways," Baker said.
State Highway Administrator Tom Tinlin said the freezing rain that moved in at 4:30 a.m. caught the state by surprise.
“I think the forecast was caught by surprise. No one forecasted that quick burst of rain that came through that washed away all that salt and the pretreat,” Tinlin said.
In Newton, 20 vehicles were involved in two separate crashes on Route 128 northbound, police said.
“It seemed to have snuck up on everybody. Most everything is slick and coated with ice. We need everybody to slow down and plan for some extra time this morning,” Newton Fire Department Lt. Eric Fricke said.
A school bus was involved in a crash at Vinton Street and the Fellways in Medford. Luckily, no injuries were reported.
A crash involving at least six vehicles was reported in Medford on Interstate 93 north at Roosevelt Circle.
A tractor-trailer rolled over on the Massachusetts Turnpike in Millbury at exit 11 and landed in the median. Two lanes of travel in both directions have been shut down.
Massachusetts State Police said Interstate 93 near Interstate 495 in Methuen was closed due to another multi-vehicle crash.
Freezing rain is making roads across the state slick. The Massachusetts Department of Transportation urged motorists to allow extra travel time.
Dozens of spin-outs were also reported on secondary roads.
Newton fire officials said the department responded to 12 crashes in 45 minutes. Police in Dedham reported several accidents within an hour, as well.
The Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority urged commuters to use extra care in parking lots and on train platforms.
Icy roads this morning. #SlowDown
— Mass State Police (@MassStatePolice) February 8, 2017
